title: Global Nighttime Lights 2023
description: Cloud-free composite of global nighttime lights from VIIRS Day/Night Band (DNB), highlighting regions of artificial lighting and dark sky preservation. Monthly composites correct for clouds and stray light.
source: Earth Observation Group, Payne Institute for Public Policy
citation: C. D. Elvidge, K. E. Baugh, M. Zhizhin, F.-C. Hsu, “Why VIIRS data are superior to DMSP for mapping nighttime lights,” Asia-Pacific Advanced Network 35, vol. 35, p. 62, 2013.
notes: Monthly cloud-free composites exclude data impacted by stray light (vcm) or include stray-light-corrected data (vcmsl). Use cloud-free observations for accurate analysis.

title: Ghana Nighttime Lights Change 2012–2023
description: Temporal analysis of nighttime radiance in Ghana showing urban growth and changes in artificial lighting over a decade. Highlights recovery and seasonal patterns.
source: Earth Observation Group, Payne Institute for Public Policy
citation: C. D. Elvidge, M. Zhizhin, T. Ghosh, F-C. Hsu, 'Annual time series of global VIIRS nighttime lights derived from monthly averages:2012 to 2019', Remote Sensing, 2021, 13(5), 922.
notes: Background areas zeroed; outlier removal applied to discard fires and isolate artificial lighting.

title: Lumen Watch: Rohingya Refugee Camps
description: Monitoring nightly changes in artificial lighting using the VIIRS Lumen Watch service. Provides long temporal profiles and nightly transects for humanitarian monitoring.
source: Earth Observation Group, Payne Institute for Public Policy
citation: Elvidge, Christopher D.; Hsu, Feng-Chi; Zhizhin, M.; Ghosh, T.; Taneja, J.; Bazilian, M. 2020. 'Indicators of Electric Power Instability from Satellite Observed Nighttime Lights', Remote Sens. 12, 3194.
notes: Prototype service for tracking nightly radiance changes in small regions. Images show transects and time-series plots.

title: Lumen Watch: Jufaynah Camp, Yemen
description: Tracking nightly radiance to observe post-conflict recovery and patterns in artificial lighting using satellite data from VIIRS DNB.
source: Earth Observation Group, Payne Institute for Public Policy
citation: Elvidge, Christopher D.; Hsu, Feng-Chi; Zhizhin, M.; Ghosh, T.; Taneja, J.; Bazilian, M. 2020. 'Indicators of Electric Power Instability from Satellite Observed Nighttime Lights', Remote Sens. 12, 3194.
notes: Useful for post-conflict analysis; highlights radiance reduction and gradual recovery.
